definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: And so my family moved to a tiny town high up in the mountains outside Denver.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們舉家遷往丹佛市外深山高嶺中的一座小鎮。

sentences.english: John Fung was born in Madagascar, Africa. His family moved back to Hong Kong when he was 13.
sentences.chinese: 馮建中，出生於非洲馬達加斯家島，十三歲舉家回港。

sentences.english: they even have days that you can get in for free for family revisiting and you can go in.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是舉家再訪，有時候你甚至能免費進去。

sentences.english: In 1932 his family moved to Lions Park, Suzhou, network, painting with great concentration.
sentences.chinese: 1932年舉家移居蘇州網獅園，潛心作畫。

sentences.english: Anybody in Cuba can get Miami on his radio.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗出生在古巴，兩歲時舉家搬遷到邁阿密市。
